author: Special Correspondent
text:
More than 250 school students from 11 States and Union Territories have registered to vie for the honours in the 61st National School Carrom Championship 2015-16 for boys and girls to be held – for the first time in the district – here from January 30 to February 3.

School Education Department would host the championship in ‘under 14, 17 and 19’ categories under the auspicious of School Games Federation of India (SGFI), S. Prasath, District Instructor of Physical Education, said here on Thursday.

He said that individual and team championships would commence at the indoor stadium at Syed Ammal Engineering College here.

The championship would be conducted in singles, doubles and reverse singles for boys and girls in the three categories and the winners would be distributed medals, shields and certificates, he said. The certificates would fetch the winners, marks for admission to professional courses under sports quota. The championship would be conducted under the watchful eyes of three observers to be deputed by the SFGI and under the overall supervision of Kalaiselvan, Tamil Nadu Chief Instructor of Physical Education. Collector S. Natarajan would inaugurate the championship on Saturday morning, after which the first round of matches would be held in 20 boards. The students would take out ‘players’ introduction rally’ at Aranmanai in the evening.

A contingent of 24 boys and girls from Haryana and Madhya Pradesh arrived here on Thursday and the others were expected to arrive on Friday.
title: Carrom championship from tomorrow
